name: RAMADA Hotel Frankfurt-Messe

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The airport shuttle was a handy thing when arriving after 9:30pm. 7 Euros for the return trip to the airport was not alot of money either. However, I found the staff at the hotel (except for the shuttle driver and one of the receptionists) to be rather abrupt and rude. We were told upon check in that coffee would be provided at all times in the lobby. When we went downstairs to get the coffee we were told that it wasn't for us but for the conference attendees (how would they know we weren't attendees?). The room was clean but showing signs of wear. The price was right ($92), the location a bit far from downtown but doable by bus. On the return to Frankfurt I booked a better hotel for less money, with a happier staff.
reviews.title: Rude staff

reviews.text: For this brief stopover at Frankfurt between flights, I got a great rate at lastminute.com of just £41 inc. breakfast.
reviews.title: A great hotel!

reviews.text: Upon arrival at Frankfurt Airport, I called up the courtesy shuttle bus and it arrived quickly (it is free of charge going to the hotel and 7 Euro returning to the airport). The shuttle arrived promptly and I was at the hotel within 15 minutes.
reviews.title: Great but not really an airport hotel

reviews.text: Check-in was a breeze and the receptionist was a very cheerful chap who was very welcoming. The room (see pics) was nice and clean although I'm not sure I liked the 70's marble in the bathroom.
reviews.title: Great Customer Service!

reviews.text: I ate from the bar menu later that evening and it was nice, although slightly over priced, as is usual I suppose.
reviews.title: Free Airport shuttle makes up for location

reviews.text: Overall this is a very nice hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful (except for the wireless issue). The rooms were very clean and mine had a lovely view of downtown Frankfurt.
reviews.title: Good hotel but, beware the Internet!

reviews.text: The wooded park around the hotel were a wonderful escape for a morning run. Heck, I'd come back to the hotel just for the park!
reviews.title: Reasonable hotel, nothing special

reviews.text: However, the hotel's internet plan was one of the most confusing and expensive charges I have ever encountered. The ISP they use offers several plans but, how and when you can use each plan is poorly communicated. I was 'robbed' of 10 euros because I didn't use my pre-paid time all at once. The hotel was unwilling to reimburse me for the unused time. Dumbest thing I have ever seen in a Marriott hotel. It's 2008, get with it!
reviews.title: Perfect!

reviews.text: Pefectly satisfactory hotel, nothing to write home about. Location is neither airpor nor city, but I was there for a conference in the hotel itsef.
reviews.title: Far from the city but it didn't matter

reviews.text: Main gripe as usual: paying for internet access in room. Why not charge for water and electricity usage as well? Rip off.
reviews.title: Loved This Lovely Serenity Hotel

reviews.text: Stayed in the Courtyard for three nights in July. Great location for access to road network for day trips to Heidelberg, Speyer, Mainz etc.
reviews.title: Good Hotel but need a car!

reviews.text: Stayed with partner & 8 year old son + found the hotel very child friendly. Accomodation tried to provide us with an extra bed (although we hadn't asked).
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.text: Pool, spa & gym facilities small but sufficient and with exceptional views over the city.
reviews.title: Clean if remote value
NIce hotel/ but remote/ great service
reviews.text: Room ok in size, but no bath in "bath"room. Breakfast buffet plentiful and with good range. Staff were also happy to go out of their way to help.

Location: Very remote. 15 minute drive to downtown Frankfurt. If you take public transportation it will require a bus + tram and the trip will take up to an hour (depending on how long you have to wait for the bus that only runs every 30 minutes). You are in the middle of the woods and there is nothing (no shopping or restaurants) within walking distance.
reviews.title: Very remote - Not suitable for Frankfurt tourists

reviews.text: I have just returned from a 6 day trip to Franfurt for a tradeshow, and, admittedly I was very hesitant of staying at this hotel due to so many negative reviews I had reviewed on this site! Unfortunately as the hotel was booked for me by someone else, I had no choice!
reviews.title: It's really not THAT BAD!!

likes.liked: — The service from the staff was great.
likes.disliked: — No facilities close by such as additional restaurants, shops etc

reviews.text: However, I must say, the hotel isn't THAT far from the city centre. It took just over 10mins by taxi with an average fare of 15Euros.
reviews.title: Dated property in desperate need of an update

likes.liked: — Kind, courteous and extremely accommodating staff--some of the best I've encountered
likes.disliked: — Quality of property, rooms and lack of amenities usually found at Marriott Courtyards

reviews.text: If you are attending a tradefair at Messe Frankfurt it is only 5 mins by taxi. There are always taxis at the hotel too.
reviews.title: Great Service!

reviews.text: Yes, the hotel is dated, however my room was quite comfortable and QUIET! Bed was huge and comfortable, great to have a balcony with fresh air, decent sized bathroom with bathtub, plenty of wardrobe space too! Good wireless facilities, however can be quite costly, particularly if you will be staying for a number of days....eg, 5euros for 30 mins. I think the internet should be free at this hotel because there really isn't anything else to do apart from work, surf the web or go for a walk around the lake that is next to the hotel..
reviews.title: Adeuate but not at all close to the airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were in Barcelona paying $258 US for a small B&B, but decided to break up the trip back to US by over-nighting in Frankfurt. I booked this property on Travelocity for $95 US. What a shock, after arriving and seeing what we had for the price. The staff was just amazing, they were accommodating from the minute we got picked up at the airport until we left. We had our dinner there, because there isn't much near the hotel and the breakfast in the morning. The dinner was great and waiters were just charming. The only problem for us was smoking, we're spoiled when it comes to this subject, Europe is behind when it comes to smoking policy. In Spain, no smoking in restaurants. The room was clean and large, although I did not use other facilities, because I was only interested in a good comfortable night of sleep. The bed was amazing, it may be that other beds I slept in during my trip was horrible, but I loved it.
reviews.title: What a pleasant surprise

description: Our hotel is in a peaceful location in the middle of a wooded area. Due to the convenient location and direct motorway connection, the airport, the Frankfurt city centre, as well as the nearby cities of Niederrad and Eschborn are within easy reach.The Frankfurt Exhibition Centre is at a distance of only 2 km. The railway station is only 6 km away, and the next bus stop is at a mere 200-metre distance.
